## SDQ vs PAS

Psychologists and social scientists frequently undertake a task known as harmonisation, which involves comparing and matching items from different questionnaires. There's a renowned comparison in this circle, known as SDQ Vs PAS. SDQ, or the Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire, is a behavioural assessment for 2-17 year olds. On the other hand, PAS, or the Pandemic Anxiety Scale (12-item) evaluates an individual's worries and thoughts related to the pandemic. Despite their differences, the process of comparing items from SDQ vs PAS can be made highly efficient and less subjective with the use of a new software tool named Harmony. Harmony employs natural language processing and generative AI models to simplify the task of questionnaire harmonisation. With Harmony, psychologists can automatically compare the differing items of SDQ and PAS, and be provided a percentage match for each item. Performing the SDQ vs PAS comparison using Harmony comes with the bonus feature of multilingual support. Whether the questionnaires are in English or another language, Harmony can handle it. All it takes is dragging and dropping your PDF questionnaires into Harmony's web interface. Take the leap today and discover a new level of ease when comparing SDQ vs PAS with Harmony.

## Compare the items in SDQ and PAS

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import SDQ and PAS into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just SDQ into Harmony</a> - compare SDQ with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just PAS into Harmony</a> - compare PAS with other instruments
